update.description:
The `gz` tool now supports output of model info:

1. `gz model -m <model_name> -i`: Output complete model information

2. `gz model -m <model_name> -p`: Output the pose of the model.

This is to address this [drcsim issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/issue/389).
update.title: Update command line tool output model info

content.raw: That's been happening since we merged [sdformat pull request 112](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/112/new-element/diff) to sdf_2.0 but haven't made a new sdformat release. As soon as we make a new sdformat release, we'll update the expected shasums in the test.
content.html: That's been happening since we merged sdformat pull request 112 to sdf_2.0 but haven't made a new sdformat release. As soon as we make a new sdformat release, we'll update the expected shasums in the test.

content.raw:
Fixed `TransportIface`. The following returns clean now:

Terminal 1: `gzserver`

Terminal 2: `for i in {1..100}; do gz model -m ground_plane -p; done`
content.html:
Fixed TransportIface. The following returns clean now:

Terminal 1: gzserver

Terminal 2: for i in {1..100}; do gz model -m ground_plane -p; done

content.raw: I've seen this as well. It prints this error after printing the model pose. I got a [nasty backtrace from a corefile](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/88368113cfad876724c5), and it seems to implicate a transport teardown issue.
content.html: I've seen this as well. It prints this error after printing the model pose. I got a nasty backtrace from a corefile, and it seems to implicate a transport teardown issue.

content.raw:
Not sure if it's related with this pull request but testing `gz model -m <model_name> -p` I got a few times this error:

```
#!c++
gz: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/mutex.hpp:108: boost::mutex::~mutex(): Assertion `!posix::pthread_mutex_destroy(&m)' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)

```
